application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details Pursuant to Condition 6 (Hard and Soft Landscaping) of planning permission ref. 21763/APP/2021/2568 (Appeal Ref. APP/R5510/W/21/3285551) dated 08/02/2022 for the 'Erection of a new residential building including duplex basement, first and roof accommodation for one replacement dwelling and 5 new dwellings with associated parking, cycle store and bin store including the demolition of the existing house.'
decision_conditions: In the absense species, planting heights and densities, as well as a programme of implementation and a programme of maintenance, insufficient details have been provided for the landscaping works. Therefore, the proposal would fail to comply with Policies D1, D4 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012),  Policies DMH 6, DMHB11, DMHB 12 and DMHB 14 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

The proposed street facing 1.8m high boundary fences along Fairfield Road and Harefield Road would result in a dominant, incongruous, visually intrusive and overbearing addition of which would cause significant harm to the host site, character and appearance of the area and visual amenities of the streetscene. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to Policies D1, D3, D4 and H2 of the London Plan (2021), Policies BE1 and H1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012) and Policies DMH 6, DMHB 11, DMHB 12, DMHB 14, DMHB 18 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
